IOT.IOTClient

Class IOTClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • IOT.IOTClient.IOTClient
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IOTClientInterface

    public class IOTClient
extends java.lang.Object
implements IOTClientInterface
    The IOTClient is mainly responisble for creating and sending messages over the network. Its implementation is independent from the underlying application.
    Version:
    Milestone1
    Author:
    Melanie, Mai

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      private java.lang.String serviceDescription
      Describes the service offered by the node the client sits on.
      private SubscriberList subscribers
      A list containing all Subscriber-objects the Client has subscribed to.

    • Constructor Detail

      • IOTClient

        public IOTClient(SubscriberList pSubscribers,
                 java.lang.String serviceDescription)
        Creates a new instance of client. This should only happen once per node.
        Parameters:
        pSubscribers - An (at first empty) list for all subscribers.
        serviceDescription - A string describing the service offered by the underlying application.

    • Method Detail

      • notifySubscribers

        public void notifySubscribers(IOTMessage message)
        Sends a message to all currently known subscribers.
        Specified by:
        notifySubscribers in interface IOTClientInterface
        Parameters:
        message - The message to be sent to all subscribers.

      • createUrl

        private java.lang.String createUrl(java.lang.String ipAddress,
                                   int port)
        This method creates a finished URL to which messages can be sent.
        Parameters:
        ipAddress - The IP address to be used in the URL.
        port - The port to be used in the URL.
        Returns:
        A String representation of an URL to which messages can be sent.

      • createSubscriptionRequest

        public void createSubscriptionRequest(java.lang.String destinationIP,
                                      int destinationPort)
        Creates and sends a subscription requests to another node.
        Specified by:
        createSubscriptionRequest in interface IOTClientInterface
        Parameters:
        destinationIP - The IP-Address the service offering originally came from.
        destinationPort - The port to which to send the request.
